newsitem.title: UK: London tea auction finds only modest demand.
newsitem.headline: London tea auction finds only modest demand.

text.p: Demand was only fair for landed teas at the latest auction by the Tea Brokers' Association of London on Monday.
Bright East Africans were 5 to 10 pence lower with only selected lines firm. Coloury mediums were steady to 5 pence lower and there were some withdrawals among the plainer sorts.
Offshores saw good demand with bright teas about steady and coloury Central Africans fully firm to dearer.
Altogether 10,680 packages were offered including 5,200 offshore. The highest price realized was 166 pence for a Kenya PF.1.
